output.conclusion: This course provides a foundational understanding of privacy-preserving machine learning techniques. By understanding these concepts, you are now equipped to explore more advanced topics and contribute to the development of ethical and responsible AI systems.
output.introduction: Welcome to the Privacy-Preserving Machine Learning course! In this course, you will learn the basics of how to train machine learning models while protecting the privacy of the data used to train them. We will cover fundamental concepts and techniques in a simplified manner, suitable for beginners with no prior knowledge of privacy-preserving methods.

chapters.chapterTitle: Introduction to Privacy and Machine Learning
chapters.description: This chapter provides an overview of the intersection of privacy and machine learning. We will discuss the privacy risks associated with traditional machine learning and the need for privacy-preserving techniques.
Here, we will define what we mean by 'privacy' in the context of data and machine learning. We'll explore different privacy notions and their implications.
We'll introduce common threat models used to evaluate the privacy risks in machine learning scenarios, such as membership inference attacks and model inversion attacks.
This chapter introduces Differential Privacy (DP), a mathematical framework for quantifying and controlling privacy loss. We will cover the basic concepts and definitions of DP.
We'll explain the privacy parameters (epsilon and delta) that control the level of privacy protection offered by DP. We'll also discuss how to interpret these parameters.
We will explore simple mechanisms for achieving DP, such as adding noise to the data or model parameters. We'll cover the Laplace and Gaussian mechanisms.
This chapter introduces Federated Learning (FL), a decentralized machine learning approach where models are trained on devices without directly accessing the raw data.
We'll describe the steps involved in a typical FL process, including model initialization, local training, aggregation, and model updates.

chapters.chapterTitle: Benefits and Challenges of Federated Learning
chapters.description: We'll discuss the advantages of FL in terms of privacy and data ownership, as well as the challenges associated with FL, such as communication costs and heterogeneous data.

This chapter introduces Secure Multi-Party Computation (SMPC), a cryptographic technique that allows multiple parties to jointly compute a function on their private data without revealing the data itself.
We'll cover the core principles behind SMPC, such as secret sharing and homomorphic encryption.

chapters.chapterTitle: Applications of SMPC in Machine Learning
chapters.description: We'll explore how SMPC can be used to perform privacy-preserving machine learning tasks, such as training models and making predictions.

modules.moduleTitle: Secure Multi-Party Computation: Privacy through Cryptography
